author: terra854
content: Is it possible to see how full or empty in terms of % the previous x number of blocks are currently? I would like to try and simulate BASEFEE price movements using that data

author: lightclient
content: `BLOCKHASH` gives you the hash of the last 256 blocks, you can prove `gasUsed` and `gasTarget` of the previous `x` blocks to see how full they are

author: sky.cactus
content: There isn't enough data available to simulate BASEFEE movements.

author: sky.cactus
content: You need end-user willingness to pay, which is a piece of data that we will not have until 1559 hits mainnet.

author: terra854
content: So the tip counts towards the gas used?

author: sky.cactus
content: The `inclusion_fee_per_gas` is part of how much gas costs, not how much gas is used.

author: phabc
content: You can use Dune analytics to look into past blocks

author: timbeiko
content: I also pinged the author and asked them to come here to discuss it, otherwise it's extremely like that no one has the right context on the next ACD
